title.rendered: How long does the IRS have to collect on your unpaid tax liability?

content.rendered: The IRS can collect on any outstanding tax liabilities for up to ten years from the filing date – and in some cases even longer. Join Optima CEO David King and Lead Tax Attorney Philip Hwang as they review what you can expect if you find yourself with aging unpaid IRS tax debt and offer tips on what you should do next.
